newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIA-BROKERS SEE INTEREST IN KALNAPILIS SHARES.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIA-BROKERS SEE INTEREST IN KALNAPILIS SHARES.

text.p: Brokers said they expected share indices to hold steady or end mixed and were optimistic about increased interest in Kalnapilis and other key shares after morning trade Thursday at Lithuania's stock exchange.

"The indices may hold steady, with the official list being hurt by Medienos Plaushas and Rokishkis Cheese, but list A should be better today because Lithuanian Gas is steady," said Kestutis Kupshys, a broker with Mendes Prior Europe.
Medienos Plaushas slumped to 11.10 litas from 11.99 litas. Rokishkis Cheese eased slightly to 42.29 litas from 42.80 litas.

Other official list shares were up, with Birzhu Milk advancing to 9.10 litas from 9.03 litas, Vilniaus Bank progressing to 225.00 litas from 222.00 litas and Hermis Bank inching up to 181.00 litas from 180.00 litas.
"There's good demand seen for bank shares, Kalnapilis, Sanitas and Lithuanian Sea Shipping Company (LISCO)" Kupshys said.
Kalnapilis, a beer brewer, edged up to 6.01 litas from 5.95 litas.
Brokers say they expect Kalnapilis and other beer stocks to do well during the hot, beer drinking months of summer.
Sanitas slid to 75.00 litas from 80.00 litas. LISCO advanced to 6.35 litas from 6.27 litas.
Brokers say another another Klaipeda-based company, Klaipeda Stevedoring company (KLASCO), is also seeing new interest.
KLASCO advanced slightly to 11.03 litas from 11.00 litas.
"We think 11.00 litas is a litte low...it might go up to 12.00 litas, step by step," said Grazhina Bachiuliene, a broker with Vilfima.
